Detailed Description

Function definition for ADC module.

This driver handles the ADC module of the AVR.

Here is a little exaple tested on AT90CAN128.

        #include <adc.h>
        #include <stdint.h>
        #include <avr/interrupt.h>

        ISR(ADC_vect)
        {
                uint16_t adcValue = adc_read();
                //Do someting with adcValue;
        }

        int main(void)
        {
                adc_select_vref(adc_voltage_ref_internal_2_56_wcap);
                adc_select_input(adc_input_channel_p1_n0_200x);
                adc_left_adjust(false);
                adc_prescaler_selection(adc_prescaler_128);
                adc_set_trigger_source(adc_trigger_source_free_running);
                adc_trigger_enable(true);
                adc_interrupt_enable(true);

                adc_enable(true);
                adc_start_conversion();

                sei();

                for(;;);

                return 0;
        }
Author:
Frédéric Nadeau

typedef enum adc_digital_channel_e adc_digital_channel_t

List of digital input channel typedef.

List of available input for ADC typedef.

List of available prescaler typedef.

typedef enum adc_trigger_source_e adc_trigger_source_t

List of available trigger source typedef.

typedef enum adc_voltage_ref_e adc_voltage_ref_t

List of available voltage reference typedef.

Note that not all voltage references are available. Availability is determined by the device used.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum adc_digital_channel_e

List of digital input channel.

Not all device are equipped with a Digital Input Disable Register. Also, not all device share the same number of input.

Enumerator:
adc_digital_channel_0 

Digital input on pin0.

adc_digital_channel_1 

Digital input on pin1.

adc_digital_channel_2 

Digital input on pin2.

enum adc_prescaler_e

List of available prescaler.

Enumerator:
adc_prescaler_2 

Oscillator clock divided by 2.

adc_prescaler_2_ 

Oscillator clock divided by 2. Alternate setting.

adc_prescaler_4 

Oscillator clock divided by 4.

adc_prescaler_8 

Oscillator clock divided by 8.

adc_prescaler_16 

Oscillator clock divided by 16.

adc_prescaler_32 

Oscillator clock divided by 32.

adc_prescaler_64 

Oscillator clock divided by 64.

adc_prescaler_128 

Oscillator clock divided by 128.

enum adc_trigger_source_e

List of available trigger source.

Enumerator:
adc_trigger_source_free_running 

ADC is in free running mode.

adc_trigger_source_analog_comparator 

Start of conversion is triggered by the analog comparator.

adc_trigger_source_ext_int_request0 

Start of conversion is triggered by the external request 0.

adc_trigger_source_timer_0_compare_match 

Start of conversion is triggered by timer 0 compare match.

adc_trigger_source_timer_0_overflow 

Start of conversion is triggered by timer 0 overflow.

adc_trigger_source_timer_1_compare_match_b 

Start of conversion is triggered by timer 1 compare match B.

adc_trigger_source_timer_1_overflow 

Start of conversion is triggered by timer 1 overflow.

adc_trigger_source_timer_1_capture_event 

Start of conversion is triggered by timer 1 capture event.

enum adc_voltage_ref_e

List of available voltage reference.

Enumerator:
adc_voltage_ref_aref 

ADC use Aref PIN as voltage reference.

adc_voltage_ref_avcc_wcap 

ADC use VCC as voltage reference with capacitor on AREF pin.

adc_voltage_ref_avcc_wocap 

ADC use VCC as voltage reference without capacitor on AREF pin.

adc_voltage_ref_internal_1_1_wcap 

ADC use internal 1.1 Voltage reference.

adc_voltage_ref_internal_2_56_wcap 

ADC use internal 2.56 Voltage reference.

adc_voltage_ref_internal_2_56_wocap 

ADC use internal 2.56 Voltage reference.

Function Documentation

void adc_digital_input_disable ( adc_digital_channel_t  chanList)

Disable digital input for selected channel.

Note:
Devices that do not support this feature will not have access to this function. It should be considered during device migration.
Parameters:
chanListList of channel that will have digital input disabled.
void adc_digital_input_enable ( adc_digital_channel_t  chanList)

Enable digital input for selected channel.

Note:
Devices that do not support this feature will not have access to this function. It should be considered during device migration.
Parameters:
chanListList of channel that will have digital input enabled.
void adc_enable ( _Bool  status)

Enable or disable ADC core.

Parameters:
statusStatus of the ADC core.
void adc_interrupt_enable ( _Bool  intEn)

Enable or disable ADC core interrupt.

Warning:
Interrupt service routine are not provided by AVR-drv. You have to write your own.
Parameters:
intEnNew interrupt status.
void adc_left_adjust ( _Bool  adjust)

Select how conversion result will be stored in register.

For 8-bits result, use:

  • adc_left_adjust(true)
  • adc_read_high()

For 10-bits result, use:

  • adc_left_adjust(false)
  • adc_read()
Parameters:
adjustAlignment of the result register.
Note:
Devices with 8-bits ADC do not support this function.
void adc_prescaler_selection ( adc_prescaler_t  prescaler)

Select ADC core clock prescaler.

Parameters:
prescalerPrescaler clock. See adc_prescaler_t for option list.
uint16_t adc_read ( void  )

Read conversion result register.

Returns:
Value in the conversion result register.
Note:
Devices with 8-bits ADC do not support this function. Use adc_read_low instead.
uint8_t adc_read_high ( void  )

Read high byte of the conversion result register.

Returns:
Value in the high byte of the conversion result register.
Note:
Devices with 8-bits ADC do not support this function. Use adc_read_low instead.
uint8_t adc_read_low ( void  )

Read low byte of the conversion result register.

Returns:
Value in the low byte of the conversion result register.
void adc_select_input ( adc_input_channel_t  channel)

Select input channel of the ADC.

Note:
Not all device share same inputs channels.
Parameters:
channelSelected channel.
void adc_select_vref ( adc_voltage_ref_t  ref)

Select voltage reference to be used by the ADC.

Note:
Not all device share same voltages references.
This function does nothing for ATmega103.
Parameters:
refVoltage reference to be used.
void adc_set_trigger_source ( adc_trigger_source_t  trigger)

Set the auto trigger source.

Note:
Not all device have the trigger source. For devices like ATmega8 and ATmega128, this function does nothing. The function has been left for these device only for API compatibility. It should be used with adc_trigger_source_free_running.
Parameters:
triggerTrigger source. See adc_trigger_source_t for option list.
void adc_start_conversion ( void  )

Start a conversion.

void adc_trigger_enable ( _Bool  trigEn)

Enable or disable the auto trigger.

Note:
For devices like ATmega8 and ATmega128, this function enable the free running mode.
For devices like ATmega103, this function does nothing.
Parameters:
trigEnTrigger enable/disable.
